doc.previous: Though most dolphins do not have hair they do have hair follicles that may perform some sensory function 36 The small hairs on the rostrum of the Boto river dolphin are believed to function as a tactile sense possibly to compensate for the Boto s poor eyesight 37
doc.after: Dolphins are often regarded as one of Earth s most intelligent animals though it is hard to say just how intelligent Comparing species relative intelligence is complicated by differences in sensory apparatus response modes and nature of cognition Furthermore the difficulty and expense of experimental work with large aquatic animals has so far prevented some tests and limited sample size and rigor in others Compared to many other species however dolphin behavior has been studied extensively both in captivity and in the wild See cetacean intelligence for more details
